name: Swift Bull Adventures
text: Trailer camping review only- we just need a quick place to stay and weren't disappointed at all. Houses right next to our campsite was a new experience for the kiddos. We backed up right to the woodline and had water and electricity. The septic dump though is at the other campsite (hence the 4/5) on the other side of base.

name: Cindy Lee
text: Nice well marked trails... we are blessed to have a place to ride at Ft Rucker..

name: Kelsey Trump
text: Beautiful location! Great place to board a horse, very nice arena and beautiful barn with many amenities!

name: Bethany Claxton
text: We love Seven Oaks and our wonderful trainer, Annie.

name: Sara Whitchurch
text: Great place! If you are looking for Horse boarding or Riding Lessons This is the place to go!

name: Erin Posey
text: Best place to take the kids, learn new skills, respect for animals and farm life. Horseback riding is an amazing, therapeutic experience and Elizabeth brings everything to life with her Equestrian knowledge!  I hope more people get to meet her and her beautiful horses!

name: William Crews
text: Great place to stay with your horse. The owners treat you like family and are good genuine folks. I’ll be back and will recommend it to those I know.

name: Sara Whitchurch
text: Best Horse Hotel/Motel in Alabama! The Mare and I felt like family! :)

name: brandon lanier
text: Such a beautiful and wonderful place to take horse back riding lessons the staff is very knowledgably. They also work with special needs individuals of all abilities such a great resource to this community.

name: brittany thompson
text: such an awesome place! very clean very friendly very professional.

name: Robert Jackson
text: Was an excellent place to have my daughters birthday party. Very clean cozy atmosphere here with the owners very welcoming and kind. Has a great seating area with tables which is a great place to set up for cake and ice cream as well.

name: Daria Wilson
text: A fun, little place for riding lessons!

name: Julie Palmer
text: Very nice people

name: Tina Selwyn
text: Children

name: Josh
text: Very knowledgable on horse training. Fair and honest God fearing people. Would definitely recommend for teaching both horse and rider.

name: Audry Vanzant
text: Beautiful horses

name: Jeremey Moss
text: Everyone was amazing! The facility spectacular! The horses Beautiful! It was our first time riding, there was a short but well executed lesson and we were off on our guided trail ride through: lush pasture, lively woods, and scenic mountain trails. Miss Lucy and Shanda were the sweetest! They were so knowledgeable about riding and the horses. They knew each horses story and temperament, and paired us perfectly according to our comfortability and novice skill level! We will be back soon!!

resp.text: Thanks! So glad you had a good experience!!!

name: Jennifer Fivas
text: This place is beautiful!! Took my daughter ro start lessons and was amazed by the price.  Lucy and Shonda are sweethearts and so encouraging and patient! We couldn't have been happier!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your wonderful review, Jennifer! I will let Shanda know!

name: Andrew Winfrey
text: Enjoy horses

resp.text: Thanks, Andrew!

name: Tena Kincaid
text: We stopped here on our way home from a camping trip. Ms. Lucy was absolutely wonderful. She was welcoming and shared a wonderful experience with my girls and 2yr old boy. They loved getting to know her horse, Buster. They enjoyed riding and made the experience perfectly appropriate for their ages. This is a genuine horse riding experience with lovely, well cared for and well loved horses. I highly recommend Pair O'Docs Farm!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! I enjoyed the time with you and your wonderful children and dogs!

name: Desiree McCombs
text: We had a great time celebrating my daughters’ 8th birthday!  Directions were easy and not too far from my location.  All the kids rode Buster and got to see/pet the other animals.  Can’t wait to go back for a trail ride!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great review, Desiree. I hope the kids had fun. Thanks for helping with the horse rides. I hope you come back soon for that trail ride!

name: The Brutus gamers
text: Plan on coming to visit when I get home.  I love horses...

resp.text: Thanks, Van! We look forward to meeting you!

name: Cameron Berryhill
text: Very sweet couple and beautiful farm.

resp.text: Thank you, Cameron!

name: Jovette
text: Love this place! Love their horse trails, very nice people!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Jo! We look forward to boarding your horses for you.

name: Cheryl Winters
text: Wonderful knowledgeable owner, manager and one boarder that I met. Gorgeous farm, miles of trails, beautiful stalls as well as lush pastures with shelters. Was given a guided tour through the trails on a glorified golf cart, well cared for horses, dressage arena, round pens, nice tack room, well organized. I'd give it much more than 5 stars! Can't wait to get my horse and move him in!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!  Looking forward to you joining our Pinchona family.

name: Jenn V
text: I can not say enough about this place. Marianne is amazing!!! The trails are lovely and the barn is so charming. Wonderful deck by a gorgeous pond for socializing. Pinchona is a home away from home.

resp.text: Thank you Jennifer we love seeing you and the family.  Nola Grace is doing such a good job tuning up Smokey!

name: Nick Girdner
text: I took my 3 year old daughter to Pinchona Farm earlier today and she loved it! Gina gave my daughter a horse handling and riding lesson for an hour and it was wonderful. Gina is an excellent instructor, interacted with my daughter superbly, and made the lesson very fun. Everyone on the farm was polite and their horses are well-tempered. This was a great experience today! We will definitely be returning to Pinchona Farm.

name: Wayne Benton
text: Beautiful farm with very knowledgeable trainers.

name: David Johnson
text: Fun

name: Patricia Ford
text: Fantastic place to board. They really care about each horse well-being.

name: angela glassford
text: Beautiful place, perfect for training of all types

name: Mary Ann Sellers
text: After a horrible day traveling, safe and clean was good. Thanks for understanding my late arrival who would expect 2 flats in 1 trip.

resp.text: My pleasure Mary Ann.   Hope to see you again on your next adventure!

name: Shae Smith
text: Very nice and clean, with large fields. Stalls are well kept.

resp.text: Thanks Shae, it was our pleasure having you visit Wadsworth Farm.  Hope to see you again.

name: Robert Presley
text: It was ok

name: Debra Sue Loyd
text: Loved this sale variety of crafts, antiques and food

name: Terry Alldredge
text: It's perfect! Just talk to them, you'll see!

name: Mykal King
text: Wonderful people who operate this farm. Beautiful place and very welcoming. Treated me like family and miss getting to be there.

resp.text: Thank you so much! Come visit us again any time!

name: Tammy Deram
text: Wonderful people!

resp.text: Thank you so much! We really appreciate you!

name: Tyler Thompson
text: Not the nicest barns but I love having so much room to ride and the lake has great fishing too. Well worth the money!

name: todd moore
text: Peaceful and serene, nature the way God intended. Beautiful horses and the kindest humans around.

name: Julie Garrett
text:
We love Rocking S! My daughter attended a camp this Summer and fell in love with horses and riding!She has now been riding there for six months and has learned so much from Suzanne and the wonderful staff. I cannot say enough about what they have taught her about riding as well as life.
It is her happy place and she never wants to leave!

name: Meagan Sharp
text: My daughter is in love with Rocking S. She has had an amazing experience and has learned so much. The people are extremely friendly and allow her to not only ride but form bonding friendships as well.  Suzanne has taught my daughter so so much!  Rocking S is definitely part of our family now!

name: Fallon Brewer
text: We absolutely LOVE Rocking S! Suzanne and all the staff are always friendly and helpful and patient and supportive teaching riders of all ages! My daughter has learned so much and improved in such a short time thanks to their hard work and dedication!

name: Samantha Hill
text: We love Rocking S Farm! Suzanne is truly devoted to providing students and families with the best experience!

name: JC Minton
text: Very friendly and professional. My daughter tried several different places for riding lessons and loves coming here.

resp.text: Thank you for choosing Rocking S!

name: Gwynne Mountz
text: My daughter (8) and I just had our first Saddle Seat lesson at Rocking S Farm. We loved it!! My daughter couldn't stop talking about it on the ride home. She was even talking about it the next day! We have both ridden before but never Saddle Seat. I thought it'd be a great idea if we signed up for lessons together. We had so much fun! Suzanne and her team are so friendly and knowledgeable! The horses are great too! You can tell they are well taken care of and are ridden often. We can't wait for our next lesson!

name: Itz_Melon_ •_•
text: Ok... The lessons were great. I had a lot of fun my first time. But they REALLY rushed Pepper (my horse) and me. They started making me post on my second lesson when I had barely learned how to steer! And don't get me started on Suzanne... So judgemental. I couldn't but I go to a way better place now, they really take their time on me.

name: melissa lamarque
text: My daughter attended horse camp here and loved it. She learned all about care for the horses, riding, and arts and crafts. She is already asking to attend again!

resp.text: We loved having her and hope you you are making plans to allow her to attend one of the many camps scheduled for 2020 and maybe even sign up for regular lessons!

name: Levi Miller
text: So horrible service rude and got mad when I asked how much do you feed him and kicked me out never go!

name: Taylor Pope
text: I love this farm is amazing for lessons party’s and camps it’s sooooo good everyone is so nice and welcoming

resp.text: We love having you!  Hope to see you soon!

name: Kassady Gibson
text: We had an amazing time at the Princess Pony Camp and will definitely be back!  This is a great place for riding and birthday parties.

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed your time with us and hope you make plans to visit with us again!

name: mckina1
text: I would like to apologize for posting any personal opinions that may have led any individual to believe that Rocking S Farms of Helena, AL, or it's owner, Suzanne Schnetzler, would be an unsuitable choice for riding lessons, boarding services or horse training. Ms. Schnetzler is genuinely kind to the students she instructs and tirelessly devotes herself to the upkeep and operation of her farm. It is not for me to say if it is right or wrong for a consumer to choose this service over another. I extend my sincerest apologies.

resp.text: Thank you for your apology and recognition that our staff is “tirelessly devoted”  to our little piece of Heaven on earth.

name: christy graff
text:
My granddaughter takes riding lessons at Rocking S Farm.  She also goes to the camps during the summer.  Believe ME if her family thought for one moment that this place was not up to standards she would not still be there after a year.  She had her 9th birthday party there and she fell in love with the farm and the animals.  I have found that when one writes a bad review on a business it is usually from a disgruntled employee or in competition with the establishment.

My granddaughter has learned how to ride and take care of horses.  She has learned that there is a lot of work that goes into running a stable and loves the hands on experience.

I have referred Rocking S Farm to a lot of people that are looking for an unique experience for their children.  I would not compromise my reputation if I did not approve of Rocking S. Farm.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!  We have loved watching our little “baby cakes” grow into a confident young lady over the years!

name: Mallie Hankes
text:
I have worked at rocking s farm for almost three years now and have been apart of them even longer. some reviews on here are quite ridiculous. Suzanne has never been arrested (lol) and is very committed to the upkeep and welfare of her farm. I can attest to this by the many, many days I have been there. the horses are feed twice a day as they should be and are given the correct and necessary treatment. I have even shadowed the large animal vet rocking s uses and she does a fine job. the stalls are always, always cleaned twice a day. I know this because Im usually cleaning them. if suzanne ever lacks help she will muck stalls on her own. she cares for her horses and only gives jobs to the people who clean the stalls correctly, which some how seemed to be quite hard for some. yes the kids help w chores but that's part of the whole horse riding experience. it's great that she includes the kids in this. it teaches them responsibility. by taking care of the animals the kids bond with them and learn the necessities of taking care of horses. farriers come to the barn regularly for saddlebreds and the other horses. it is a wonderful little barn full of wonderful people. the negative reviews on here are honestly absurd and obviously don't know what they're talking about.

also a negative reviewer posted a picture on here. horses who live in pastures are going to get scratched. it's absolutely inevitable. I've owned many horses before who have been pasture boarded and different barns and can say this w full knowledge. it is not evidence that rocking s farm is unsuitable. the horse doesn't need a vet to some out it only needs for the wound to be cleaned and medicated (which it has been).

name: Coach Jimmy
text: kind of rude on the phone...doesn't know how to answer phone.

name: Dexter Willis
text: Great people.

name: crystal joiner
text: Mrs. Mici is a kind wonder lady at heart.  I would recommend her with facts based upon that.  This boarding facility is all about the care of your horse.  every need requested was met.  I am thankful that I met this wonderful lady and all of her blessings and kindness she gave.  She goes out of her way to help and make sure you are fine with everything she gives daily updates as along with you can visit anytime you want with your horse.  She has beautiful land plenty of grass and wonderful trails and blueberry patch for the scenery to be a prime example just to relax and enjoy your horse.  Your needs are met with the help of her, shes one of a kind and I honestly am thankful i met her.  Once again this is such a wonderful place and i would say to anyone you would be blessed to board your horse(s) here.  You wont find another place like it.  <3

resp.text: All I can say I WOW and thank you so very much for those wonderful sentiments ! IT has been my pleasure to meet you and Tater. I have been lucky to have such wonderful clients that become friends here.

name: Casey Humphrey
text: I called to get info and for a little education, as I am new to owning horses. She was very helpful! She is extremely knowledgeable with years of experience under her belt. I am grateful for the education!

resp.text: Thank you so much! I look forward to meeting you in person! I enjoy sharing what I know and happy to be of help.

name: Keith Hall
text: Mrs. DIX has a beautiful property of naturally grown Blueberries.  She is a sweet and wonderful lady.  The prices on the blueberries are great and she does all the work.  They are ready to go when you want make the order.  I will. I will be getting my blueberries from her for now on.

resp.text: Thank you! I think the berries enjoy the stress free atmosphere as much as the horses and people do!

name: Rebeca Gomez
text:
Simply called to get some information i have been searching for an immersive experience. When I contacted this facility the woman was very short with me and and told me in a sarcastic tone "i dont have a petting zoo i have a boarding facility" all i wanted was to see what this farm offered and she hung up on me when i expressed that she didnt have to be rude with me. You never know if i am a prospect customer, treat everyone kindly.

***update*** Owner justifies staff hanging up on me and not giving me information. You never know who you are speaking to and you never know who can bring you business. You cant mistreat people regardless of what you provide. I was never told they offered tours or anything like i said i was told in a very sarcastic rude tone "this is not a petting zoo this is a boarding facility". If you think you're entitled to treating people this way thats fine just know i wouldnt recommend anyone i know to you. As for what you are saying about a child looking at a horse; what would have been your potential customers are not children, we are all adults...paying adults. Thanks for blocking my replies by the way instead of reaching out to me.

resp.text:
*** UPDATE: I HAVE REACHED OUT REPEATEDLY... when a person is not willing to respond, then there is nothing I can do. This facility cares about its business which is caring for the horses put in our care.  *** THIS is the original post to Ms Gomez :...I was told a call came in from someone to see horses and have an experience with them. I have no clue what " an immersive experience" is  . We DO arrange for some tours as an informative and educational experience. WE DO have working students and volunteers here from time to time. HOWEVER, The owners do not wish their horses to be disturbed and in fact , we do not accept boarders that have other needs than what we offer here. When that happens they are referred to another facility in the area more suitable for their needs. WE do have stable owned horses that are used for this educational experience.I cannot imagine anyone here who and received information that a person just wanted to have a child look at a horse responded like that. We board and offer therapeutic and great care for horses and every minute is spent with caring for the animals here.
We are a serious equine facility that gives complete care to horses and go beyond the norm to achieve the best care for all here. .IF a person calls and does not get what they perceive as the response they want, we can not be responsible for that. You cannot judge the facility's level of care which is why we are in this business, with the fact someone does not like how they were talked to. IF you want great care and concern by educated and experienced staff, then call us. We will be more than happy to talk. our facility can be viewed at www.dixcamelotfarms.com .**********.MS GOMEZ:THIS IS OUR UPDATE TO YOU..WE DID NOT BLOCK ANYTHING. FEEL FREE TO CALL US AGAIN. YOUR CONTACT INFO WAS NOT RECEIVED. I WAS OUT OF STATE WHEN ALL THIS WENT ON.  I will be HAPPY to speak with you.

name: Marie Fisher
text: Awesome people and horses!!

name: Kathy Hofstadter
text: My grand children love taking riding lesson here.The stables are beautiful and the pastures full of horses is amazing.

name: Bob Gnarley
text: After bringing home a Kentucky Saddler I realized Id made a few glaring mistakes in  my attempt to prepare him a proper shelter. I was in need of a nearby stable and started looking. I liked what I saw there.

name: Robert A Cutrer
text: Very nice stables, and horses. They will give riding lessons and see to know their craft.

name: Thomas Rogers
text: Wonderful farm. Wonderful people. Convenient location. Great place!

name: Kalani Parker
text: This is so great I love the place im the program and it's wonderful

name: chad sanders
text: Great place and family ! Nice horses and stables

name: Michael Clisbee
text: Number is disconnected, don’t even know if they’re still running

name: Brooke Turner
text: great location

name: Diana Nides
text: My 4 year old loves his instructor Ms. Maggie and pony Mystic!

name: Tracy Fischer
text: this a great experience for my grand baby

name: cindy goodrum
text: Wonderful trainers. Love their horses. Granddaughter loves the riding lessons.

name: Nicholas Imsand
text: I may be biased. But this is a wonderful place that has been doing great work for 20+ years. You will never find a more loving and caring staff and Mrs. Leah knows her stuff!

name: Caroline Tash
text: Great atmosphere. I have been taking lessons for five years now! Great experience for beginning riders to experienced riders! You should consider OAK MEADOWS, for your child of any age.great for little kids to adults of any age.

name: Ed Hardy
text: Awesome

name: Bai Bai
text: Starting lessons for my daughter! The owner is so nice!! Genuine and so homey!! Thumbs up!!

name: Tammy Barber
text: Patient instructors. Reasonably priced! Love the people!

name: Robert Good
text: Friendly atmosphere and knowledgeable training.

name: Shannon Josey
text:
Gorgeous barn WITH wash rack and arena to ride in! Several acres for your horses to graze. There is also a second small barn with feed/hay storage.

Would recommend this place to anyone!! I would give it 10 stars if I could 😁

name: Vicky Fry
text: Wounderful place

name: Robyn Johnson
text: Beautiful set up for horses. Busy road but excellent barn.

name: Diana McMurchy- Amato
text: Very friendly and a beautiful Facility

name: Connie McMullen
text: Peaceful and quiet with horses well cared for

name: T Abra
text: Awesome Victoria is amazing guide family had a great time

name: Tadisa
text: Great first horse riding experience!

resp.text: Thank you for coming out! We look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Victoria Light
text: StarLight Farms has great horses. You can take a lesson or trail ride.

resp.text: Thanks! Come back and see us!!!

name: Chris
text: Very helpful.  Great area for riding horses, and right next to the national forest.

resp.text: Thank you. We look forward to seeing you again.

name: Victoria Whitehead
text: It's a little piece of paradise!

name: Christina High
text: Friendly staff and well cared for animals

resp.text: Thank you! We look forward to seeing you again.
